2 week deranking simulator for ryze one tricks is not as fun as you might think. 9.3 patch didn't even mention it, so it looks like we'll be stuck in hell until **hopefully **the next patch.

11 days isn't even a patch cycle, I'm not aware if you know how software engineering works in a corporate environment, but every fix in under a patch cycle (so, unplanned), is a hotfix, and hotfixes are applied exclusively when necessary. Because this bug doesn't break the game, Riot could have at most put up a disclaimer not to play Ryze or disable him. They do not owe you a hotfix for some champ whose absence doesn't really matter.

Also, like someone said, it might be a really complex bug. If you were here in the old days, I think Shen was banned from competitive for a year or more because they couldn't reproduce a bug, I think it was that he would sometimes not TP to his target after his ult. And that was a way more obvious bug than this is.
It was first noticed 11 days ago. Who knows how long prior to that the bug came to be

Let me ask you something. How exactly do you expect anyone to fix a bug they don't know about? Do you think Riot, or any tech company employs slaves to look through their tens of millions of lines of code in hopes of finding a bug? Because statistically there is a big chance that LoL has a bug that was introduced in beta, yet you don't seem to complain about that bug, because you don't know of it. So what gives you the right to criticize a company for not fixing a bug they didn't know about if you get to only complain about bugs you know about?

I posted this two weeks ago

Not only is this damage reduction a stupid interaction with Ryze EQ, but he is hands down the lowest performing champion in solo queue consistently for at least the last two and a half years, averaging the lowest winrate by far of any champion in any role. You can look at any credible lol stat history site and see this for yourself. But Ryze is really strong in the right hands, you might say. Well the dude who made this post this is a 3 million mastery point diamond Ryze OTP and he's not happy. I'm at 1 mill only and frankly Ryze feels shit to play after the last 5 nerf batches or so. Yes Ryze works in the right hands, I've heard it over a thousand times by now. But that's the very definition of "right hands" because if it _didn't_ work it wouldn't be the right hands. Anything works in the right hands. 

I have been a Ryze main for literally over a third of my life thus far and been through every iteration with the exception of alpha Ryze. And I stuck with him in his darkest times of 37% win rate, never ceasing to play him. I simply do not give a damn how weak Ryze is actually. But for all these years playing him, it's never been more unfun playing him in his current state. And it only seems to be getting worse. And I'm not even surprised if Ryze were to get a nerf next patch instead of fixing this bug.
